reviews.text: Great place very big and spacious with great arty pieces on display, very organized and the best thing of all it's that it's open on Sundays and entrance is free

I've never been to JAG and i always pass by especially when i'm travelling back home so its really amazing to actually spend some time in there and get to experiance exquisitely crafted artworks,sculptures along with installations. It really felt like travelling in a time capsule because i lost so much sense of time and i had such a lovely time there.
The Art Gallery is so amazing and very educating about the South African history overall it's a place you can take kids with for excursion
M sure was passing by, I've never entered the place, m sure it pretty good.

What a nice place. But building deteriorating very fast. Collection is Great. Value of that collection is not equal to care. Tourist get robbed to rich this. Destination. Very sad.. The best to get taxi and go to JAG a great exhibition. Monday is always closed. Building conditions is very a bad state. Entrance free of charge.

The history of South Africa told through transport. From horse dragged carriages, to vintage cars and  fire fighting trucks, the classic rolls Royce and bicycles I only read in history books. It has all you would want to know about South Africa's past in the perspective of transportation. You can take as many personal photos as you can, professional photography is on arrangement , no entrance fee and the place has a kid friendly play area.
Great museum. Entrance is free and kids enjoyed the Sunday afternoon. Thanks had fun.
I enjoyed seeing all the vintage cars... I even learned more the transportation history

Transport history at its best. A vast spectrum  of Johannesburg and South African transport modes ranging from a display of the last blacksmith in Johannesburg, Sam Sawitz, who manufactured and repaired Oxwagon wheels to double decker busses and trains. Well worth the visit
Well looked after museum brings back so much memory. Time well spend.

Huge amount of material to read and very interesting but there needs to be some direction arrows to help guide the people . Do not think of it as a quick one hour museum . It requires at least two hours if not four . The Nelson Mandela section is great but once again needs direction arrows to follow the theme . In my personal opinion I think more could be made of the rainbow nation at the end to show the success of the struggle. Please do not forget our international guests and their different languages.

It was amazing. Different sections dedicated to the freedom fighters, pictures and videos rehashing the experience. I saw letters, diaries, clothing, the first vehicle given to Nelson Mandela, etc. It was "deep". Much deeper than the movies I have watched in the past. Movies that relayed the same story. I will definitely visit again if the opportunity ever presents itself.

Very beautifully and artistically crafted museum. All you would want to know about Apartheid and the history of south Africa in one place. No photography is allowed in the main museum hall. But all in all its a spectacular way to tell a sad story.

One of the best museums I have ever been to. 
I could have stayed a day there. Visiting this museum was such an enriching experience. I especially enjoyed the 2 different entrances... but I won't say too much... it is surprising
Definitely worth a visit. Fantastic display of South African history. So much to see, read and learn. You'll need at least 3 hours, if you are not afraid to read.

Without doubt this is probably the best buffet style restaurant that I’ve ever eaten in.  The quality and the vast offerings were amazing.  Then they bring out the weapons such as the eye fillet steak, salmon, chips with garlic and parsley as the entree, need I say more.

This is a must if you are visiting Buenos Aires. Top of the line all-you-can-eat cold cuts, excellent meats. We sat outside on the grass overlooking the sea. Waiters are top notch. Prices are around U$S 30 each, which is super low for us visitors.
 As a native Argentinean myself, I know abut Argentinean meat and restaurants. Do not pay attention to locals complaining about prices. Maybe this is not the place for them and some locals love to argue and complain. 
I was at Rodizio Costanera 3 days in a row!!.
I will-of course-be back when I return to Buenos Aires.
Excellent service, awesome meat, and a wonderful river view.
Tofo ok
It has a nice view, fair prices, but do not go to their bathroom
Amazing everything.best place even if you are alone.top service,top food,and top music love love love love it

The portions are plentiful. The prices are reasonable for what you're getting. They cater. The pizzas can be a little stodgy. The gourmet milkshakes are out of this world. I recommend you have them as a sit - down order. As a takeaway, you'll miss out on all the toppings. They are very filling.

reviews.author_name: Creativity is essence of a life well spent
reviews.text: Great pizza and potato skins. Simply delicious.

Loving it. Was craving a Cajun pizza the other day, just to find out that Catz has reopened around the corner from where I stay. I ordered a Cajun pizza via Uber Eats and was more than delighted by the pizza. The nostalgia that came rushing back and had a thug tear rolling down my cheek.

I placed my order via orderIn and I received my food timeously. 
The savoury waffle and chicken meal was tasty. I will definitely order again and probably check it out in person.
Goto place if you are a gamer!!

The best quality junk food. Large portions and very tasty. A bit pricey but worth it. It is best to order in advance telephonically as they get extremely busy and the wait can be quite long during peak times.

Very nice 👌
Small place, not enough parking, BUT the services are good and the food they sell is very tasty.
Owners /managers and the staff responded very well. 
Plan your visit to avoid the peak hours , they sell freshly prepared food and it gets really busy,. You might have to wait 20 minutes or  longer at those periods. 
Truly one of the best places we have been. ..
Very nice 
👌👌👌
Amazing take aways .. a old time place family owned ..the best fish and chips ..my favourite  is sollys  special .. a must try for every South African
Jhb best on the run food...being going here for ages now love it
Why can't we see the prices of things before we buy them

Good vegetarian options, although now they have  changed their menu and it's more expensive . However food is still good. 6 of us ate for R500 with a lot to take home as well, so good value for money. Staff are friendly and service is good.
Food is amazing. Staff is very polite and friendly. definitely going to be a regular
Incredible service from Thandi , she is so friendly ! Food came extremely fast and was top quality. Absolutely delicious, will definitely be coming back again soon !
Always great service. And the food quality is top notch 👌
Mexican fast food: fast, cheap, good service. Good parking.
